intrusionPreventionRules.name: Identified Diginotar Certificate
intrusionPreventionRules.description: This filter heuristically blocks exchange of Secure Socket Layer (SSL) certificate issued by Diginotar.

intrusionPreventionRules.name: Identified Fraudulent Digital Certificate
intrusionPreventionRules.description:
This rule heuristically prevents the exchange of Secure Socket Layer (SSL) certificate whose trust has been revoked. 

Ref: Microsoft Security Advisory (2798897).

intrusionPreventionRules.name: Identified Fraudulent Digital Certificate - 1
intrusionPreventionRules.description: This rule heuristically prevents the exchange of Secure Socket Layer (SSL) certificate whose trust has been revoked.

intrusionPreventionRules.name: Kubernetes API Proxy Request Handling Privilege Escalation Vulnerability (CVE-2018-1002105)
intrusionPreventionRules.description:
A privilege escalation vulnerability has been reported in the API component of Kubernetes. The vulnerability is due to insufficient handling of error conditions from backend servers. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted request to a vulnerable Kubernetes API server. Successful exploitation could result in the escalation of privileges which would permit the execution of arbitrary commands inside pods on the affected node.

Note: To monitor SSL Data Stream, agent (DSA) needs to be configured via "SSL Configuration Wizard" and has to acquire the Server SSL certificate where DPI rule is assigned.

intrusionPreventionRules.name: Kubernetes Dashboard Authentication Bypass Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVE-2018-18264)
intrusionPreventionRules.description:
An information disclosure vulnerability has been reported in Kubernetes Dashboard. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted request to a vulnerable Kubernetes Dashboard server. Successful exploitation could result in the attackers gaining access to Kubernetes cluster secrets and other sensitive information.

Note: To monitor SSL Data Stream, agent (DSA) needs to be configured via "SSL Configuration Wizard" and has to acquire the Server SSL certificate where DPI rule is assigned.

intrusionPreventionRules.name: Kubernetes API Server Denial of Service Vulnerability (CVE-2019-1002100)
intrusionPreventionRules.description: Kubernetes API Server is prone to a denial of service vulnerability. An attacker may leverage this vulnerability to disrupt the availability of a Kubernetes cluster.

intrusionPreventionRules.name: Identified Revoked Certificate Authority In SSL Traffic (ATT&CK T1032)
intrusionPreventionRules.description:
This rule prevents the use of revoked/unauthorized Root/Intermediate CAs based on the list of configured CA/Issuers.

Note: Configuration options are provided to configure CA (Certificate Authority).

intrusionPreventionRules.name: Identified SSL/TLS Diffie-Hellman Key Exchange Using Weak Parameters Client (ATT&CK T1032)
intrusionPreventionRules.description:
This rule is intended to identify Diffie-Hellman Ephemeral Cipher suites using parameters with 512 bits length.  The SSL/TLS session keys created with weak parameters could allow an attacker to recover the plain text on the encrypted channel.

This rule will detect if the SSL/TLS client is using DHE weak parameters.

intrusionPreventionRules.name: nginx "ngx_http_parse_chunked()" Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
intrusionPreventionRules.description: nginx is prone to a stack based buffer overflow vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue allows attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the vulnerable application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial of service condition.

intrusionPreventionRules.name: HTTP Protocol Decoding
intrusionPreventionRules.description: Required by all other HTTP DPI rules. This DPI rule decodes the HTTP protocol, restricts URI and query lengths, and validates URI encoding.

intrusionPreventionRules.name: Identified Kubernetes Unprotected Primary Channel Information Disclosure
intrusionPreventionRules.description:
Kubernetes is vulnerable to Information Disclosure Vulnerability. The debugging endpoint is exposed over the unauthenticated Kubelet healthz port. The go pprof endpoint is exposed over the Kubelet's healthz port. This debugging endpoint can potentially leak sensitive information such as internal Kubelet memory addresses and configuration, or for limited denial of service.

Note: Configuration options are provided to set the event frequency of this rule. Administrators are advised to configure this rule with IP(s) of trusted host(s) to allow Kubernetes traffic.

intrusionPreventionRules.name: Identified Kubernetes API Server LoadBalancer Status Patch Request
intrusionPreventionRules.description:
This filter detects an attempt to set the PATCH status of loadBalancer in Kubernetes API server. While not inherently malicious, the traffic could indicate an attempt to exploit a vulnerability in Kubernetes API server's design that could allow an attacker who is able to patch the status of loadBalancer to potentially intercept web traffic.

Configuration Note: Configuration options are provided to set the IP(s) of trusted host(s) to pass traffic.
